author: Correio do Povo
title: Instituto Caldeira amplia apoio ao programa Geração Caldeira afetados pelas enchentes
text: Instituto Caldeira amplia apoio ao programa Geração Caldeira afetados pelas enchentes Desde as chuvas que impactaram o estado do Rio Grande do Sul no final de abril e começo de maio, o hub vem arrecadando recursos para doação publicidade O Instituto Caldeira, hub de inovação e fomento à nova economia localizado em Porto Alegre (RS), ampliou a ação de apoio aos jovens participantes do programa Geração Caldeira que tiveram suas casas e famílias impactadas pelas enchentes do fim de abril e início de maio: o número de jovens que vão receber os recursos financeiros arrecadados pelo instituto aumentou para um total de 100 - inicialmente, a meta era ajudar 30 jovens. Desde as chuvas, o Caldeira disponibilizou um canal de doação via Pix para aqueles que quiserem e puderem doar recursos financeiros, com o objetivo de usar da sua rede e do alcance da sua comunidade para arrecadação: no site institutocaldeira.org.br/sosrs estão listadas todas as formas de doação, em reais, dólares e euros. Os recursos estão sendo destinados por meio da Operação de Volta Para Casa, iniciativa que vem mapeando quem precisa de suporte financeiro direto para reestruturar seus lares. "As famílias recebem um cartão carregado com créditos, que permite consumo em redes varejistas locais para a reconstrução das casas", explica Pedro Valério, Diretor Executivo do Instituto Caldeira. "Desde as enchentes, viemos monitorando a situação de todos os 250 alunos formados pelo Geração Caldeira, e, com o sucesso das arrecadações, pudemos aumentar a meta de doações." Ellen Kaylane Prudêncio Laranjeira, aluna da segunda turma do Geração Caldeira, está entre os jovens que receberam os recursos arrecadados. "A água chegou aqui em casa umas três e meia da manhã, quase quatro. Tive que acordar a minha avó e tirá-la de casa", ela conta, sobre o dia em que a enchente atingiu a casa da família. Ellen vive no bairro Farrapos, um dos mais impactados pelas chuvas. "Perdemos tudo. Os móveis que eu ajudei a minha avó a comprar, com aquele dinheirinho suado, que eu ficava horas na rua durante a pandemia para ganhar. A água levou muitas das nossas memórias felizes daqui." Com o dinheiro das arrecadações, Ellen diz que a família pretende comprar os móveis novamente, além de utensílios de cozinha. "Fazer parte do Caldeira foi e é um marco", ela complementa, a respeito do Geração Caldeira e da relação com o Instituto. "Eu amo trabalhar lá com a LeV, e sentir que eu ainda pertenço ali." O Geração Caldeira é um programa educacional gratuito com foco em inclusão produtiva, que seleciona e forma talentos para a nova economia. A edição 2024 do programa está mantida, e a etapa online já começou. O Geração Caldeira é destinado a jovens de todo o Brasil, que tenham entre 16 e 24 anos de idade, e que estejam cursando ou tenham cursado o ensino médio na rede pública (ou particular com bolsa acima de 50%). Os 200 alunos selecionados ao fim do processo seletivo recebem bolsa de R$ 3 mil durante a etapa presencial e são encaminhados para vagas de trabalho. As trilhas educacionais oferecidas neste ciclo são Marketing e Design, Programação Python, Programação Java, e Gestão e Vendas. Caldeira reabriu as portas no último dia 10 No dia 10 de junho, o Instituto Caldeira abriu as portas pela primeira vez desde as chuvas. O espaço físico do hub fica no Quarto Distrito, uma das regiões de Porto Alegre que foram mais afetadas pelos alagamentos - o prejuízo estimado na estrutura do prédio foi de cerca de R$ 35 milhões. Inicialmente, serão usados apenas o segundo e o terceiro andares do instituto: o primeiro andar permanece em processo de restauração. As 69 empresas residentes do primeiro andar do Instituto Caldeira foram realocadas nos outros dois andares, onde foram abertas 200 novas posições de trabalho temporárias.

author: Valley City Times-Record
title: Choicese (CHC-SES) Drives Financial Digitization, Enhancing Financial Inclusion | User | times-online.com
text: In a major collaboration, Choicese (CHC-SES), the internationally renowned investment platform, has announced a strategic partnership with a leading brokerage firm to introduce stock trading services. By combining their expertise and resources, Choicese (CHC-SES) aims to provide investors with a convenient and secure stock trading platform, enabling them to participate in the stock market and embark on new investment journeys. This collaboration will further drive the development of the stock market, offering investors more options and increasing investment opportunities. With the booming stock market, an increasing number of investors are eager to participate in stock trading, seeking the opportunities and returns it offers. To meet this demand, Choicese (CHC-SES) has partnered with a well-known brokerage firm to launch stock trading services, providing investors with a convenient and secure trading platform. Through its collaboration with brokerage firms, Choicese (CHC-SES) has expanded its service range, enabling investors to trade stocks on the same platform. Investors can easily access the stock market through the Choicese (CHC-SES) app or online platform, executing buy and sell orders. This seamless integration offers investors a more convenient trading experience, saving time and effort. Additionally, the collaboration with brokerage firms brings more trading tools and features to Choicese (CHC-SES). Investors can access real-time market data, stock analysis, and research reports through the Choicese (CHC-SES) trading platform, aiding them in making informed investment decisions. The platform also provides trade execution and settlement services, ensuring the security and efficiency of the transaction process. This partnership positively impacts the development of the stock market. The global influence of Choicese (CHC-SES) combined with the brokerage firms' expertise will provide investors with more investment options and opportunities. Investors can choose stock trading strategies that suit their investment goals and risk tolerance, engaging in market fluctuations. The introduction of stock trading services will further promote the development of the stock market, increasing market liquidity and activity. Investors will be able to invest more flexibly, seizing more investment opportunities. Choicese (CHC-SES) will continue to collaborate with brokerage firms, offering investors more comprehensive and convenient investment services, collectively fostering the prosperity and sustainable development of the stock market. Disclaimer: The information provided in this press release is not a solicitation for investment, or intended as investment advice, financial advice, or trading advice. It is strongly recommended that you practice due diligence (including consultation with a professional financial advisor) before investing in or trading securities and cryptocurrency. author: John Delmenico
title: “You can’t trust big tech, that’s why you should give them a copy of your ID” says PM
text:
Prime Minister who’s embarrassingly desperate for Murdoch’s approval, Anthony Albanese has told the nation that we can not trust the big tech giants, and that is why you should want to give them enough information to steal your identity.
“The time to protect children is now,” said the government that is fine with children seeing gambling ads, getting locked up, and even the inhumanity of listening to Kyle and Jackie-O.
“We must protect the children by making their only option be reading News Corp papers. That way they wont be randomly exposed to violent sexism, racism and homophobia. They will be systematically shown it instead.”
“We simply can’t trust the tech giants or do reform that focuses on making them act because that wont get me good headlines before the election.”
“We also can’t trust the experts, even the ones we cite say that our rushed law is ‘harmful’. Clearly they just want to brain wash our children into being thugs.”
“So just give them your ID, and also we will be making them track your location harder. What’s the worst that can happen? Name one time that a massive company has misused data or been hacked.”

author: VNExplorer
title: Japan's 'Moon Sniper' makes historic 'pin-point' lunar landing
text:
Japan’s ‘Moon Sniper’ makes historic ‘pin-point’ lunar landing
NEW DELHI: Japan made history on Friday, becoming only the fifth nation to land a spacecraft on the Moon. The US, the Soviet Union, China and India are the only other nations to have accomplished the feat so far.
Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency’s Smart Lander for Investigating Moon (Slim) probe, dubbed the “Moon Sniper”, landed on the slope of a crater just south of the lunar equator using “pinpoint technology”. The craft’s landing site was an area within 100 metres (330 feet) of a spot on the surface, far tighter than the usual landing zone of several kilometres.
“No other nation has achieved this. Proving Japan has this [pinpoint] technology brings us a huge advantage in upcoming international missions like Artemis,” said Shinichiro Sakai, JAXA’s SLIM project manager. The pinpoint technology has been previously used by Japan to successfully land probes on two asteroids.
JAXA stresses its high-precision technology will become a powerful tool in future exploration of hilly Moon poles, seen as a potential source of oxygen, fuel and water.
The successful Moon landing reverses Japan’s fortunes in space after two failed lunar missions and recent rocket failures, including explosions after take-off.
Two probes
Slim will deploy two mini-probes – a hopping vehicle as big as a microwave oven and a baseball-sized wheeled rover – that will take pictures of the spacecraft.
Tech giant Sony Group, toymaker Tomy and several Japanese universities jointly developed the robots.
Japan is increasingly looking to play a bigger role in space, partnering with close ally Washington to respond to China’s military and technological might, including in space. Japan boasts a number of private-sector space startups and aims to send an astronaut to the Moon as part of Nasa’s Artemis programme.
In August last year, India’s Chandrayaan-3 made a historic touchdown on the Moon’s south pole, a major technological feat given the rough terrain, highlighting India’s rise as a major player in space.
Japan is also planning a joint unmanned lunar polar exploration with India in 2025.
(With inputs from agencies)
